Key Match Events: David Fry blasted a two-run homer in the seventh inning and added a run-scoring sacrifice bunt in the ninth
Relievers Hunter Gaddis (1-0), Tim Herrin and Emmanuel Clase held the Tigers to one run over the last 3 2/3 innings
Justyn-Henry Malloy doubled, went to third on a groundout and came home on a groundout by Jace Jung
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland earned its first playoff win when facing elimination since Game 6 of the 1997 World Series in Florida
The Guardians had dropped 11 consecutive postseason elimination games since then, the longest such losing streak in MLB history
Miscellaneous Highlights: The winner will face either the New York Yankees or Kansas City Royals in the ALCS beginning Monday in a best-of-seven series
The Guardians — who had 11 hits in the game — snapped a 20-inning scoreless streak in the first inning
Jose Ramirez belted his first home run of the postseason in the fifth inning
Others: Lane Thomas singled to right field and Kwan scored from third base
Trey Sweeney’s sacrifice fly to center scored Colt Keith
Zach McKinstry tied the score at 2-2 leading off in the bottom half of the inning
Detroit’s Kerry Carpenter scored from second base on a single by Wenceel Perez
The Tigers loaded the bases in the bottom of the second and tied the score at 1
Reese Olson, who allowed one run on five hits over four innings with one walk and four strikeouts
Chad Smith was immediately replaced by after allowing four hits and two runs in four-plus innings
Beau Brieske (0-1) with two outs in the seventh
Will Vest’s throw at the plate was not in time to tag a sliding Brayan Rocchio
